Module nbbrd.picocsv
Package nbbrd.picocsv

Class Csv.Writer

java.lang.Object
nbbrd.picocsv.Csv.Writer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, Flushable, AutoCloseable, Csv.LineWriter
Enclosing class:
Csv
public static final class Csv.Writer extends Object implements Csv.LineWriter, Flushable, Closeable
CSV writer. Writes text to a character-output stream, buffering characters in order to provide efficient writing.

This class is created by a static factory method. 

 try (java.io.Writer chars = ...; Csv.Writer csv = Csv.Writer.of(Csv.Format.DEFAULT, Csv.WriterOptions.DEFAULT, chars)) {
   ...
 }
While chaining streams on creation is possible, it is recommended to use the "try-with-resources with multiple resources" pattern instead. This ensures that the resources are properly closed on a class initialization failure.

The buffer size can be specified. Ideally, it should align with the underlying output but the Csv.DEFAULT_CHAR_BUFFER_SIZE should be ok for most usage.
Note that the CSV writer maintains its own buffer so there is no need to create a BufferedWriter.

See Also:
